question:
You recently received a letter from a friend asking for an advice about whether to go to college or try to get a job. you think that he should get a job




write a letter to your friend.
text: How have you been? I hope this letter finds you well. I've heard that you are planning to go for higher education. However, I think it wouldn't be a wise decision to make as it is going to cost you areally high.

Alternatively, I think you should definitely look for a job instead. Getting employment will not only help you with earning money but also learning other skills such co-operation and presentation skills. Besides, it'll facilitate you getting true freedom and as you are travel enthusiastic, you'll be able to travel more as you save more.

Finally, I'd like to hint at the kind of jobs, you can opt for. Because I find you a great singer, it will make you a suitable candidate for vacancies at hotels. Moreover, since you are interested in computers, you can look for a technical job too which will eventually pay you off really well.
All the best. Hoping to hear from you soon.
